sub_topic: Using the power rule to differentiate functions
message_1: Differentiate the following function using the power rule: f(x) = 3x^5.
message_2:
To differentiate the function f(x) = 3x^5 using the power rule, we apply the rule:

(d/dx) (x^n) = n * x^(n-1)

In this case, n = 5. So, we have:

f'(x) = 5 * 3x^(5-1)

f'(x) = 15x^4
